field.name: Language

definition.attribution: Dublin Core Metadata Element Set, Version 1.1: Reference Description at http://dublincore.org/documents/dces/

field.definition: A language of the intellectual content of the resource.

dos.practice: The language(s) in which a text is written or the spoken language(s) of an audio or video resource. Visual images do not usually have a language unless there is significant text in a caption or in the image.
A resource may include multiple languages. Use separate Language elements (i.e., repeat the element) to enter multiple languages.
Where practical, the content of this field should coincide with RFC 1766: Tags for the Identification of Languages. Examples: en, de, es, fi, fr, ja, th, and zh.
In addition to using language codes, if needed, a textual description of the nature of the language may be included in the Description element. Example: In German and English, in parallel columns.
